Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South2nd FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2596special.collections@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2021-08-10T19:23:06Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content StandardAugust 2021
Record updated by Rachel Searcy to reflect 2021 accretion Materials are primarily in English, with a small number of items in French.
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Bill Koehnlein Papers
Koehnlein, Bill
Picher, Marie-Claire
TAM.792
2.5 Linear Feet in 5 manuscript boxes
1971-2007 1971-1988 William (Bill) W. Koehnlein was a peace and social justice activist based in New York. Koehnlein was an active member of the anarchist community from the 1960s to the 1980s, involved in numerous organizations. He co-founded the Anarchist Switchboard, a collective project based in East 9th Street in Manhattan. Materials related to that project are included in the collection, as well as booklets, leaflets, independent publications, and typewritten drafts on the topic of anarchism. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Marie-Claire Picher, Bill Koehnlein's wife, in May 2019 with a further accretion donated in August 2021. The accession number associated with these gift are 2019.122 and 2021.033.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Biographical Note
William (Bill) W. Koehnlein (1949-2017) was a peace and social justice activist based in New York. Koehnlein was an active member of the anarchist community from the 1960s to the 1980s, involved in numerous organizations. He co-founded the Anarchist Switchboard, a collective project based in East 9th Street in Manhattan.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Bill Koehnlein Papers; TAM 792; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Scope and Contents
The Bill Koehnlein Papers primarily consists of materials on the topic of anarchism, including booklets, leaflets, independent publications, and typewritten drafts of original writings. The collection also includes bills, organizational documents, and flyers from 1986 related to Anarchist Switchboard/Alchemical Space, an anarchist space in the East Village.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Processing Information
Some materials were rehoused in new acid-free folders during accessioning.
Appraisal
Three duplicates of pamphlets have been retained.
